'''Joltik''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''バチュル''' ''Bachuru'') is a dual-type {{2t|Bug|Electric}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Galvantula}} starting at [[level]] 36.

==Biology==
[[File:Sylvester Joltik size.png|thumb|200px|left|Joltik's size compared to a {{p|Beartic}}. Joltik is next to Beartic's underarm.]]
At 4 inches (0.1 meters) tall, Joltik is one of the smallest Pokémon in existence. It has four legs tipped with blue, conical feet. Its ovoid body is completely covered in yellow fur, with notable tufts sticking out on each side of its face, just over each eye, and its lower back. Joltik has four blue eyes. The two larger eyes are set relatively far apart on its face, containing black pupils. The two smaller {{wp|simple eye}}s are situated between the first pair, slightly higher up on its face. Joltik's mandibles point downward and reside at the bottom of its face, where they closely resemble tufts of hair.

Joltik is too small to generate its own electricity, so it attaches itself to larger Pokémon and feeds off their static electricity. It will also make its way into houses and feed off electricity in electrical sockets. All of the energy it absorbs it stores in an electric pouch on its body. As seen [[BW028|in the anime]], Joltik is not especially aggressive, but will defend itself if bothered. It has [[BW062|been demonstrated]] that if Joltik is unable to find a source of energy, it will be unable to move and in serious danger. Joltik, and its evolution {{p|Galvantula}}, are [[Signature move|the only Pokémon that can learn]] {{m|Electroweb}} by leveling up.

==In the anime==
[[File:Joltik anime.png|left|thumb|220px|Joltik in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Joltik debuted in ''[[BW028|Oshawott's Lost Scalchop!]]'', where a wild Joltik was accidentally mistaken as [[Ash's Oshawott]]'s missing [[Scalchop and seamitar|scalchop]]. When Oshawott put it on his stomach, the angry Joltik started to shock Oshawott until it was taken off.

{{OBP|Sylvester|BW039}} owns a Joltik that he used to battle [[Georgia]] in ''[[BW039|Reunion Battles In Nimbasa!]]'' during the [[Club Battle]]. They lost when {{TP|Georgia|Beartic}} fell on top of Joltik.

Multiple Joltik appeared in ''[[BW062|Crisis at Chargestone Cave!]]''. They and {{p|Galvantula}} stole electricity from Pokémon and objects to feed on because the rocks in the [[Chargestone Cave]] that they normally fed on were being stolen by {{TRT}}.

A Joltik appeared in ''[[BW088|The Mystery of the Missing Cubchoo!]]''.

===Minor appearances===
Multiple Joltik appeared in ''[[BW081|Crisis at Ferroseed Research!]]''.

==Trivia==
* Joltik is the only Pokémon with a base stat total of 319.
* Joltik is tied with {{p|Flabébé}}, {{p|Cutiefly}}, {{p|Comfey}}, and {{p|Cosmoem}} as the [[List of Pokémon by height|smallest]] Pokémon.
* Joltik was designed by [[Saya Tsuruta]].

===Origin===
Its Pokédex entries state that it latches onto larger Pokémon to drain their static electricity, so it may be based on a {{wp|tick}}. It may also be based on a {{wp|jumping spider}} or, like its evolution, a {{wp|tarantula}}.

====Name origin====
Joltik may be a combination of ''jolt'' and ''{{wp|tick}}''.

Bachuru may be a combination of バチバチ ''bachibachi'' (onomatopoeia for electric crackling) and タランチュラ ''taranchura'' (tarantula). It may also be a combination of ''bug'' and 虫　''chū'' (bug, an alternate reading of ''mushi'').
